This can be due to volcanic or tectonic activity, earth-moving for construction or extraction purposes, and subsidence or uplift due to changes in groundwater or underground reservoirs.

If the phase spectra from one acquisition to another differ so much that they can’t be compared, that can indicate an area that has undergone such drastic change that it can’t be resolved.
